data.title: Add message about 64bit to the Linux requirements fixes #1973
Error message when restarting and installing update
data.body:
I received an error message when upgrading from 0.93 to 0.94 using the auto-updater:
![screen shot 2014-05-06 at 4 43 07 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/563517/2896035/8d0a9466-d567-11e3-8c62-4646f64e762a.png)

data.title: Linux 32bit support
data.body:
I just spent a few hours trying to get atom to work on my 32bit install of Arch.

After digging around I discovered [atom needs 64bit architecture to work for the time being](https://github.com/atom/apm/issues/78#issuecomment-38238240). That comment is from two months ago though, so I am wondering if it is still true.

If it is, a note in the README could save people some time.

data.title: fixed Windows path slash
Implements multiple selections clipboard paste
data.body:
It provides the fix for #1928.

Includes:
- Passing the selection index in the `Editor::mutateSelectedText`
  method callback
- Storing all the selections content on many calls of
  `Selection::copy` with `maintainClipboard = true` in a metadata
  `selections` array
- Handling clipboard with a `selections` metadata in
  the`Editor::pasteText` method

data.title: Editor window height decreases after each run. Ubuntu 14.04
Add .desktop file during installation
data.body:
Add `/usr/share/applications/Atom.desktop` with following content when installed on Linux machines:

```
[Desktop Entry]
Name=Atom
Exec=/usr/local/bin/atom
StartupNotify=true
Terminal=false
Type=Application
Icon=/usr/local/share/atom/resources/app/resources/atom.png
```

This makes Atom visible for launchers like Unity or Gnome Shell.

data.title: /usr/bin/env: node: File o directory doesn't exist
data.body:
Hi,

I'm trying to build on Ubuntu 14.04, when running:

```
/usr/bin/env: node: File o directory non esistente
```

It says `/usr/bin/env: node: File o directory doesn't exist` but in fact the file exist and executing it opens the node console

data.title: Enable Support for OSX 10.7
data.body:
It seems that Atom explicitly doesn't work on OSX 10.7, instead only working on 10.8 and higher.

Any reason for this choice? Would you consider merging changes to enable 10.7 support, or is there something in 10.8 that's critical to the application?

Thanks,
R

data.title: Ignored names doesn't accept .* as a valid input (to hide all files beginning with a '.', standard unix philosophy)
data.body:
Inputting `.*` into the Ignored Names setting does not read it as a valid wildcard for any files/folders beginning with a `.` 
In unix and things based off/designed around, files and folders beginning with a `.` are classed as hidden and by default should be hidden by things listing the directories unless they are explicitly told to list the hidden files. I'm not asking for this, but at least a way to achieve this, through the use of `.*`. 

I believe the Ignored Names setting should be accept any form of wildcard, be it `*.file`, `*somefilename*` or `.*`. And currently believe that this is a bug in the system currently implemented.

data.title: Final atom binary requires root/sudo to launch
data.body: After running the grunt install task, I have a working atom binary, but it requires root/sudo to launch. Fixing the permissions on /usr/local/bin/atom to be executable by all causes atom-shell to launch without the atom editor.

data.title: Do not keep unchanged files open
data.body:
If you open a project in Atom only to look around at different files it keeps each buffer opened (with a tab). If you click on some 10+ files the editor quickly gets cluttered down and you have to eventually close the pane.

I propose an option to not keep buffers open unless you change something in the file, then it can stay open.

data.title: Atom menus in ubuntu 13.10 are cut off or don't show
data.body:
The top menus are being cut off. This means that I click on the menus and no menu rolls down, but the menu bar still displays the hovering effect as it should.

![ubuntu-no-menus](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/976915/2895600/d564dc7c-d561-11e3-8662-ec243bf51a61.gif)

This is a recurrent issue with some applications on ubuntu, the more common one is the eclipse issue. check: http://askubuntu.com/questions/361040/eclipse-menus-are-cut-off-or-dont-show

a quick fix for this is to run from the command line every time that you want to run atom:

``` shell
$ UBUNTU_MENUPROXY= atom
```

OS details: Ubuntu 13.10 x64

---

EDIT: Added the screenshot

data.title: libgcrypt version issue on Arch Linux
data.body:
Version required by atom is older than the current version on arch linux:

```
/tmp/atom-build/Atom/atom: error while loading shared libraries: libgcrypt.so.11: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

After creating the symbolic link:

```
sudo ln -s /usr/lib/libgcrypt.so /usr/lib/libgcrypt.so.11
```

Atom gives this error, so a symbolic link workaround is not possible:

```
/tmp/atom-build/Atom/atom: /usr/lib/libgcrypt.so.11: version `GCRYPT_1.2' not found (required by /tmp/atom-build/Atom/libchromiumcontent.so)
```

data.title: build fails since grunt binary not found
data.body:
build fails for me on debian 32-bit with the error:

```
events.js:72
        throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
              ^
Error: spawn ENOENT
    at errnoException (child_process.js:988:11)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:779:34)
```

I checked this happens because script/build resolves grunt's location to "build/node_modules/.bin/grunt" which is absent.

data.title: Make sure gyp uses Python 2 (#1933)
data.body:
gyp/npm uses /usr/bin/python to build, which is a problem on systems where
/usr/bin/python is Python 3 or higher.  Fortunately, you can tell npm which
Python to use.

data.title: AutoUpdater uncaught exception after update to 0.93.0
data.body:
After updating to `0.93.0` and restarting it showed it had one more update, but when it finished and I clicked to 'Restart and Install Update' it crashed:

```
ReferenceError: AutoUpdater is not defined
  at EventEmitter.autoUpdater.quitAndInstall (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/auto-updater.js:27:7)
  at AutoUpdateManager.module.exports.AutoUpdateManager.install (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/auto-update-manager.js:109:26)
  at AtomApplication.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:252:39)
  at AtomApplication.EventEmitter.emit (events.js:98:17)
  at AtomApplication.module.exports.AtomApplication.sendCommand (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:390:22)
  at item.click (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/application-menu.js:185:45)
  at MenuItem.click (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/menu-item.js:38:18)
  at delegate.executeCommand (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/menu.js:78:31)
```

data.title: Link to API-Reference returns 404
data.body: The Link to the API-Reference (https://atom.io/docs/api/) points to /v0.94.0/api/ which is not available.
